title: Typst Package Manifest
description: Schema for typst.toml package manifest files, used by the Typst package manager and universe.

name.description: The package's identifier in its namespace. Should use kebab-case if it contains multiple words. Should not contain 'typst'. See https://github.com/typst/packages/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#submission-guidelines for detailed requirements.

version.description: The package's version as a full major-minor-patch triple (following SemVer, no pre-release or build tags). See https://semver.org/

entrypoint.description: The path to the main Typst file (relative to the package root) that is evaluated when the package is imported.

authors.description: A list of the package's authors. Each author can provide an email address (<user@example.com>), homepage (<https://example.com>), or GitHub handle (<@typst>) in angle brackets. Required for Typst Universe submission.

license.description: The package's license. Must contain a valid SPDX 2.3 expression describing one or multiple licenses that are either OSI-approved (https://opensource.org/licenses/) or CC-BY-4.0, CC-BY-SA-4.0, or CC0-1.0. See https://spdx.dev/learn/handling-license-info/. Required for Typst Universe submission.

description.description: A short, clear description of the package (one sentence recommended). Required for Typst Universe submission.

homepage.description: A URL to the package's web presence (e.g., documentation website).

repository.description: A URL to the repository where this package is developed (e.g., GitHub, GitLab). Used if homepage is not set.

keywords.description: An array of search keywords for the package.

categories.description: An array with up to three categories from the official list to help users discover the package.

disciplines.description: An array of disciplines from the official list defining the target audience. Should be empty if generally applicable.

compiler.description: The minimum Typst compiler version required for this package to work (SemVer format). Partial versions like '0' or '0.13' are supported. Pre-release tags are not supported.

exclude.description: An array of globs specifying files (relative to package root) that should not be part of the published bundle. Do not exclude README or LICENSE.

template.description: If present, declares this package as a template.

path.description: The directory within the package (relative to package root) containing files to be copied into the user's new project directory.

entrypoint.description: Path relative to the template 'path' directory pointing to the main file to be compiled after initialization.

thumbnail.description: Path relative to the package root pointing to a PNG or lossless WebP thumbnail (min 1080px on longer edge, max 3MB) depicting the initialized template.

tool.description: Namespace for third-party tools to store their own configuration.
